FuncDef:
The ptp device-type command sets a clock mode for a 1588v2 device.
The undo ptp device-type command deletes the configured 1588v2 clock mode for a 1588v2 device. The ptp device-type command sets a clock mode for a 1588v2 device. The undo ptp device-type command deletes the configured 1588v2 clock mode for a 1588v2 device. By default, no 1588v2 clock mode is configured. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H-48S6CQ, CE6881H-48S6CQ-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Configures a 1588v2 device as a boundary clock (BC). A BC has multiple 1588v2 clock interfaces. One interface of a BC synchronizes time signals with its upstream clock, and other interfaces advertise the time to downstream clocks.
-

Configures a 1588v2 device as an ordinary clock (OC). Only a single interface on an OC belongs to a 1588v2 domain. This interface synchronizes time signals with its upstream clock and advertises the time to downstream clocks.
-

ExtraInfo: Before 1588v2 is used for clock synchronization, you must configure the clock mode for the device according to the network plan.
